wikipedia_page.main: Samuel David Colkett (1806– 24 January 1863) was an English artist, known for his work in oil painting . He was a member of the Norwich School of painters.

response: *Samuel David Colkett and Victoria Susannah Colkett

Stark taught his own son Arthur, as well as Alfred Priest, Henry Jutsum and Samuel David Colkett, all of whom emerged to become minor artists.Cust, Dictionary of National Biography, 1885–1900, Volume 30. Their artistic styles were heavily influenced by their teacher, and none of them produced notable works of art. Arthur James Stark specialised in depicting landscapes and animals, and drew the cattle on a few of his father's pictures.

The British Museum holds a few drawings by Vincent, once part of an album, and three drawings once attributed to him, but which are now recognised as being drawn by the Norwich artist Samuel David Colkett.
